content: replace marker into st just made single_crochet in next 9 sts 10 sts round 5 remove marker single_crochet into that st and replace marker into st just made single_crochet in next 3 sts inv decrease single_crochet into next 4 sts 9 sts rounds 6 10 single_crochet around 9 sts stuff the stardrive section do not assembly stuff the circular wall surrounding using gray yarn first sew the saucer the concave deflector dish at the and stardrive sections together as shown front it helps to push the tip of then sew the warp nacelles onto the your finger into the dish while you stardrive section as shown make the are stuffing connections firm so the parts don t twist or sag round 11 in blo single_crochet around - 9 sts finishing cut yarn leaving a 10 tail use now complete the remainder of the a tapestry needle to thread yarn embroidery i used white yarn on the through each of the stitches in the saucer to represent windows i also used last round and pull the hole closed red to make lengthwise stripes on the warp nacelles insert needle through center and all the way through stardrive section using gray yarn attach hanging loop emerging in the center of round to saucer section i recommend using 1 catch a few of the stitches from your crochet hook to help you find the round 1 preferably symmetrically attachment point where the ship hangs around the circle then insert the level just take a guess hook a stitch and needle back into the center hole let it hang from your hook then try and all the way through to the rear again until you find the right spot center pull tight and help shape the concave deflector dish and the whole stardrive section with your fingers this gauge stitch will help the dish hold its concave shape fasten_off yarn securely and cut using blue yarn or desired color embroider a starburst pattern inside the deflector dish warp nacelles make two using gray yarn round 1 magic_ring 8 or ch2 then work 8 single_crochet into 1st st - 8 sts rounds 2-10 single_crochet around - 8 sts round 11 in blo single_crochet around - 8 sts cut yarn leaving a 6 tail use a tapestry needle to thread yarn through the last round starship enterprise saucer section stardrive section warp nacelle deflector dish and all terms and concepts relating to star trek including original uss enterprise design © of sts and pull tight to close hole fasten_off yarn and cut cbs studios increase crochet adaptation of design and photography © 2012 long dog knitter this pattern is for personal noncommercial use only and shall not be monetized in any way ever do not embroider the warp nacelles until after assembly if you have any questions about the pattern please feel free to send them by email to knit@ longdogknitter com or through ravelry to username longdogknitter
